utilities

Class PlayerListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.PlayerListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    city.cs.engine.StepListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PlayerListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements city.cs.engine.StepListener
    Listens for step events in the game world to update the camera's position based on the player's movement. This class ensures that the player remains in view as they navigate the game world, by adjusting the game view's center to follow the player.
    Since:
    1.0

      • preStep

        public void preStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
        Specified by:

      • postStep

        public void postStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
        Updates the camera's position to follow the player after each physics step. The camera is centered on the player's position with a slight vertical offset to provide a better view of the surrounding game world.
        Specified by:
        postStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event object containing information about the physics step.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player newPlayer)
        Sets the current player to be tracked by this listener. Allows the listener to adjust if the player entity changes or needs to be updated.
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - The new player entity to track.
